dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 662 RH: Block Grant Assistance Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. C. Scott Franklin of Florida (for himself and Ms. Wasserman Schultz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

Additional sponsors: Mr. Dunn of Florida, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Posey, Mr. Diaz-Balart, Mr. Soto, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Steube, Mr. Waltz, Mrs. Cammack, Mr. Gimenez, Ms. Lee of Florida, Mr. Rutherford, Mr. Moskowitz, Mr. Mills, Mr. Bilirakis, Mr. Webster of Florida, Mr. Mast, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Mrs. Luna, Mr. Bean of Florida, Ms. Castor of Florida, Ms. Wilson of Florida, Mr. Buchanan, Mr. Gaetz, Ms. Lois Frankel of Florida, Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas, Mr. Frost, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Valadao, and Ms. Perez
Reported from the Committee on Agriculture; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the Disaster Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2023 to improve disaster relief funding for agricultural producers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Block Grant Assistance Act of 2023.

section.header: Disaster Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2023 amendment
section.text: Title I of the Disaster Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2023 (division N of Public Law 117–328), is amended, in the matter under the heading Office of the Secretary under the heading Processing, Research and Marketing under the heading AGRICULTURAL PROGRAMS under the heading DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, by inserting : Provided further, That the Secretary of Agriculture may provide assistance for losses described under this heading in this Act in the form of block grants to eligible States and territories before the period at the end.

endorsement.action-desc: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
